DOC.brief_summary: Participants will undergo a single session of functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI)-based neurofeedback (approximately 1 hour). The investigators will assess their ability to regulate motivational networks of the brain during the exposure to alcohol cues and evaluate immediate effects on craving and cognitive bias for alcohol by administering a questionnaire and a Stroop task before and after the session.
DOC.brief_title: Optimisation of Functional MRI-based Neurofeedback for Alcohol Use Disorders
DOC.criteria: History of alcohol use disorder or current alcohol consumption above 21 units (1 unit = 8g) of alcohol per week (male participants) or above 14 units of alcohol per week (female participants) MRI safety exclusion criteria
